title: How to Make Glazed Apples

steps.headline: In a small bowl, mix together the juice, ginger and cinnamon.
Melt the butter in the skillet over medium heat.
Add the apple rings, in batches.
steps.description: Cook until each side is browned and remove each browned batch and set aside.

steps.headline: When all of the apple rings have been cooked, place all of them back in the skillet.
steps.description: Pour the juice mixture over the top, then sprinkle with sugar.

steps.headline: Place a lid over the skillet.
steps.description: Cook for 5 minutes over medium heat or until the apples appear softened and glazed.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: These are perfect on their own but if you love ice cream or whipped cream, these make great additions.

steps.headline: Carefully cut the core from the apples.
Peel a thin strip of skin from around the center of the apple.
Mix sultanas, brown sugar and cinnamon in a bowl.
Press this mixture firmly into the center holes in the apples.
Put a dab of butter on top of each apple.
Put the apples in a microwave-safe baking dish.
steps.description: Add the golden syrup and water.

steps.headline: Cook in the microwave on high for 5 minutes.
Remove the apples from the microwave and pour the melted syrup over the apples.
steps.description: Do this carefully, as it will now be very hot.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Let cool for 3 minutes before serving. Serve cream or ice cream with it––these toppings enhance the taste.

text: Skillet version In a small bowl, mix together the juice, ginger and cinnamon.  Melt the butter in the skillet over medium heat.  Add the apple rings, in batches. Cook until each side is browned and remove each browned batch and set aside. When all of the apple rings have been cooked, place all of them back in the skillet. Pour the juice mixture over the top, then sprinkle with sugar. Place a lid over the skillet. Cook for 5 minutes over medium heat or until the apples appear softened and glazed. Serve. These are perfect on their own but if you love ice cream or whipped cream, these make great additions. Microwave version Carefully cut the core from the apples. Leave the bases intact. Peel a thin strip of skin from around the center of the apple.  Mix sultanas, brown sugar and cinnamon in a bowl.  Press this mixture firmly into the center holes in the apples.  Put a dab of butter on top of each apple.  Put the apples in a microwave-safe baking dish. Add the golden syrup and water. Cook in the microwave on high for 5 minutes.  Remove the apples from the microwave and pour the melted syrup over the apples. Do this carefully, as it will now be very hot. Return to the microwave. Cook on high for 5 minutes. Remove from the oven. Let cool for 3 minutes before serving. Serve cream or ice cream with it––these toppings enhance the taste.
